item.title: 富裕买家回流，香港豪宅销售反弹
item.description: 香港豪宅销售在第一季度出现复苏，原因是房地产限购令的取消吸引了富裕买家的回归。【原文：Hong Kong’s luxury residential sales recovered in the first quarter as the removal of property curbs lured back wealthy buyers.】

item.title: 英国市场无舵漂流
item.description:
历届保守党政府监督了英镑的下跌和英国股票的缩水。【原文：

Successive Tory governments have overseen the decline of the pound and the diminishing of UK equities. 

】

item.title: 欧洲央行历史性降息或将巩固欧洲股市的牛市地位
item.description: 欧洲央行本周召开的历史性会议可能会成为推动地区股市再创新高的催化剂。【原文：A historic European Central Bank meeting this week may be the catalyst that drives regional equities to new peaks.】

item.title: 欧洲央行的通胀挑战看起来越来越像美联储的挑战
item.description: 欧元区通胀率的回升正越来越多地引起人们将其与美国进行比较；这加剧了人们的担忧，即欧洲中央银行在降低利率时可能会面临与美联储类似的障碍。【原文：The uptick in euro-zone inflation is increasingly drawing comparisons to the US — fueling concern that the European Central Bank could face similar impediments to lowering interest rates as the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 瑞士就欧洲最高医疗费用进行投票，辩论内容与美国如出一辙
item.description: 瑞士人正准备投票决定是否限制医疗系统的个人费用，因为该系统向用户收取的费用比欧洲任何其他国家都要高。【原文：The Swiss are getting ready to vote on whether to curb the personal costs of a health system that charges its users more than in any other country in Europe.】

item.title: 印度大选结果让紧张的莫迪公牛松了一口气
item.description: 早上好，我是驻孟买的证券记者阿舒托什。由于这两天的密集活动，我们的市场成为全球焦点，而总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）则是这一切的中心。莫迪的政党在大选中表现不佳，导致昨天股市暴跌，但我们可能会迎来一些反弹；很明显，莫迪将在盟友的帮助下继续领导国家。再过几天，情况就会恢复正常。【原文：Good morning, this is Ashutosh, an equities reporter in Mumbai. Our markets are in the global spotlight, thanks to two days of intense activity, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi right at the center of it all. His party’s less-than-stellar election win sent equities plummeting yesterday but we could be in for a bit of rebound — it’s pretty clear that Modi will continue to lead the country, with some help from allies. Things should get back to normal in just a few days.】

item.title: 路透社称卡塔尔主权基金将收购中国大型共同基金公司 10% 的股份
item.description: 据路透社报道，卡塔尔主权财富基金已同意从私募股权公司 Primavera Capital 收购中国最大的共同基金公司之一--华夏基金管理有限公司 10% 的股份。【原文：Qatar’s sovereign wealth fund has agreed to buy a 10% stake in China Asset Management Co., one of the nation’s largest mutual fund firms, from private equity company Primavera Capital, Reuters reported.】

item.title: 贝莱德、Citadel 支持德州后起之秀挑战纽交所和纳斯达克
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：BlackRock Inc., Citadel Securities and other investors are backing an upstart Texas stock market to challenge to the New York Stock Exchange and Nasdaq Inc.】

item.title: 澳大利亚瞄准 "绿色清洗"，养老基金追随先锋队
item.description: 澳大利亚企业监管机构在推动投资经理更加关注环境、社会和治理资质方面取得了又一次胜利。【原文：Australia’s corporate watchdog notched another victory in its push to sharpen the focus of investment managers on environmental, social and governance credentials.】

item.title: 铝生产商 Novelis 暂停 9.45 亿美元的美国 IPO
item.description: 铝生产商诺维利斯公司（Novelis Inc.【原文：Aluminum producer Novelis Inc. has postponed a plan to raise as much as $945 million in an initial public offering that would have been one of the biggest listings in the US this year.】

item.title: 日本央行 "惊吓 "市场，对冲基金在日元期权交易上翻云覆雨
item.description: 据市场参与者称，对冲基金正在退出日元期权交易，突然出现了大量看涨日元的押注。【原文：Hedge funds are backpedaling on yen option trades with a sudden spate of bullish bets on the currency, according to market participants.】

item.title: 莫迪誓言掌权，印度股指期货止跌回升
item.description: 周二，印度大选结果显示，印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）领导的政党失去了议会多数席位，将需要依靠盟友组建政府。【原文：India’s stock futures rose, gaining back a small part of losses suffered Tuesday when election results showed Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s party lost its majority in parliament and will need to rely on allies to form a government.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：贝莱德和花旗集团计划在德克萨斯州新建证券交易所
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》报道，一个由贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：A group backed by investors including BlackRock Inc. and Citadel Securities is planning an upstart stock market in Texas in a challenge to the New York Stock Exchange and Nasdaq Inc., the Wall Street Journal reported.】

item.title: 债券守望者忧心忡忡 莫迪弱胜财政民粹主义恐慌
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）在民调中的胜率低于预期，这让债券投资者担心民粹主义会进一步抬头。【原文：A smaller-than-expected poll victory for Prime Minister Narendra Modi is leading to worries among bond investors about greater populism.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。美国劳动力市场出现降温迹象，债券反弹。波音公司老板警告孤立风险。纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）的政党不再拥有议会多数席位。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. Bonds rally on signs of a cooling US labor market. Boeing’s boss warns about isolation risks. And Narendra Modi’s party no longer has a parliamentary majority on its own. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 中国人将数十亿资金转入香港银行以寻求更高的收益率
item.description: 汇丰控股有限公司第一季度在香港吸引了超过 13 万名新银行客户。中国银行（香港）在 2023 年新增了 20 万名跨境客户，而恒生银行去年的非居民新开户数猛增了 342%。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc attracted more than 130,000 new bank customers in Hong Kong in the first quarter. Bank of China (Hong Kong) gained 200,000 new cross-border clients in 2023, while at Hang Seng Bank, new account openings for non-residents jumped 342% last year.】

item.title: 美国库存有增加迹象，油价维持在四个月低点附近
item.description: 由于一份行业报告指出美国原油库存增加，加剧了欧佩克+计划增加供应的看跌情绪，原油跌幅维持在四个月低点附近。【原文：Oil held losses near a four-month low as an industry report pointed to an increase in US crude stockpiles, adding to bearish sentiment compounded by OPEC+’s plan to boost supply.】

item.title: 亚洲债券追随美国反弹；股市涨跌不一：市场综述
item.description: 在美国劳动力市场降温的迹象刺激降息押注后，国债反弹，债券有望在亚洲早盘攀升。股市开盘涨跌不一。【原文：Bonds are poised to climb in early Asia trading after Treasuries rallied on signs of a cooling US labor market that buoyed rate-cut bets. Stocks are set for a mixed open.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利在 "前所未有 "的时刻减持墨西哥股票
item.description: 在即将上任的左派领导人克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）当选后，摩根士丹利放弃了对墨西哥股市的积极看法。【原文：Morgan Stanley ditched its positive view on Mexican stocks following the election of Claudia Sheinbaum, the incoming leftist leader who is expected to take office with stronger-than-expected legislative support.】

item.title: 威士忌制造商三得利在日本罕见出售 5 亿美元债券
item.description: 三得利控股有限公司（Suntory Holdings Ltd.）发行了 5 亿美元的债券，使这家备受赞誉的威士忌制造商成为今年仅有的几家进入美国货币债务市场的非金融类日本公司之一。【原文：Suntory Holdings Ltd. priced a $500 million dollar bond, making the manufacturer of well-regarded whiskeys one of only a few non-financial Japanese companies to tap the US currency debt market this year.】

item.title: 明治安田生命保险称将尽量减少日本债券购买量
item.description: 明治安田生命保险株式会社认为，日本长期国债的收益率还有进一步上升的空间，因此将暂时保持最低限度的购买量。【原文：Meiji Yasuda Life Insurance Co. sees room for yields on long-maturity Japanese government bonds to rise further and will keep purchases of the securities to a minimum for the time being.】

item.title: 债券交易员对美联储加快减息步伐投入新的赌注
item.description: 随着国债反弹，债券交易员们再次倾向于鸽派，纷纷押注将从美联储加快降息步伐中获益。【原文：Bond traders are tilting dovish again, piling into wagers that would benefit from a faster pace of Federal Reserve interest rate cuts as Treasuries rally.】

item.title: 萨默斯认为美国长期国债收益率将长期走高
item.description: 美国前财政部长劳伦斯-萨默斯（Lawrence Summers）表示，随着时间的推移，他认为长期利率会越来越高。【原文：Former US Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers said he sees higher long-term interest rates over time.】

item.title: 塞内加尔发行 7.5 亿美元欧洲债券，市场不确定性有所缓解
item.description: 塞内加尔成为今年第四个利用该市场的撒哈拉以南非洲国家，其债券销售表明投资者对其新政府越来越有信心。【原文：Senegal became the fourth sub-Saharan African nation to tap the market this year, with a bond sale that shows investors are gaining confidence in its new government.】

item.title: 所罗门合伙人公司聘用威廉-布莱尔银行家索兰吉-贝拉斯克斯
item.description: 根据一份声明，Natixis 支持的精品投资银行 Solomon Partners 已聘请 Solange Velazquez 担任芝加哥的董事总经理。【原文：Solomon Partners, the boutique investment bank backed by Natixis, has hired Solange Velazquez to be a managing director in Chicago, according to a statement.】

item.title: 路易斯安那州枪支法案有可能扰乱华尔街的小额贷款业务
item.description: 路易斯安那州不久将禁止 "歧视 "枪支实体的银行参与政府合同，此前立法者提出了与德克萨斯州一项法规类似的立法，该法规对华尔街公司的公共财政工作造成了冲击。【原文：Louisiana could soon bar banks that “discriminate” against firearm entities from working on government contracts, after lawmakers advanced legislation that’s similar to a Texas statute that has whipsawed Wall Street firms’ public-finance work.】

item.title: 地区性银行投资者对轻微阵痛毫无胃口
item.description: 说到商业地产，美国银行业的投资者都心有余悸。【原文：When it comes to commercial real estate, investors in the US banking sector are on edge.】

item.title: 受美国收割压力影响，小麦将创 11 月以来最长跌势
item.description: 小麦期货连续第五个交易日下跌，创下六个多月来的最长连跌记录，原因是美国的收割进度快于分析师的预期。【原文：Wheat futures headed for the fifth straight daily decline — the longest such streak in over six months — as the American harvest progressed more quickly than analysts expected.】

item.title: 埃纳米公司表示，智利锂项目吸引了大量投资者的兴趣
item.description: 智利国营矿业公司埃纳米公司（Enami）表示，作为智利政府努力开发更多世界最大储量的一部分，该公司的一个锂矿项目正受到潜在合作伙伴的广泛关注。【原文：Chilean state mining firm Enami says it’s getting plenty of interest from prospective partners in a lithium project as part of the government’s efforts to tap more of the world’s biggest reserves.】

item.title: 石油算法交易商在欧佩克出人意料后放大原油价格跌幅
item.description: 由于欧佩克+意外表示计划在今年晚些时候向市场恢复部分供应，依赖趋势跟踪算法的石油交易商加剧了本周原油的抛售。【原文：Oil traders that rely on trend-following algorithms compounded a selloff in crude this week as OPEC+ unexpectedly signaled plans to return some supplies to the market later in the year.】
